motion: Governments should ban face recognition technology in public spaces.
Nuclear power is necessary to achieve global net-zero emissions.
Large social media platforms should be legally responsible for harmful content recommended by their algorithms.
Remote work is better than in-office work for most knowledge workers.
AI systems should be required to disclose when users are interacting with a machine, not a human.
Universal basic income is a better anti-poverty tool than expanding targeted welfare programs.
Gene editing of human embryos should be permitted for disease prevention.
Cryptocurrencies provide net social benefit compared to traditional banking systems.
Public transit should be fare-free in major cities.
College admissions should eliminate legacy preferences entirely.
Open-source AI models are safer for society than closed-source models.
Telemedicine should remain reimbursed at parity with in-person visits.
Carbon border adjustment tariffs are necessary to prevent emissions leakage.
Schools should ban smartphones during instructional hours.
Large language models should undergo independent safety audits before deployment.
Gig workers should be classified as employees rather than independent contractors.
News organizations should refuse to publish hacked or leaked materials.
Nations should commit to phasing out internal combustion engine vehicle sales by 2035.
Facial recognition at airports should be opt-in only.
Developed countries should forgive the sovereign debts of low-income nations tied to climate impacts.
Publicly funded research should require immediate open access publication.
Social media platforms should verify the identity of political advertisers.
Autonomous weapons should be banned under international law.
Data collected from consumer IoT devices should be automatically deleted after one year.
Teachers should be allowed to use AI tools for lesson planning without student disclosure requirements.
